Research

Graduate Student Researcher

University of California, Berkeley, School of Public Health, Group in Biostatistics

Aug 2013 to May 2015; Aug 2015 to Present
Berkeley, CA

In collaboration with trauma surgeons at San Francisco General Hospital and the University of California, San Francisco, as well as my advisor, I work on varied projects related to exploration and prediction of trauma patient outcomes.

Staff Research Associate

University of California, San Francisco, School of Medicine,
Department of Psychiatry

Dec 2012 to Jan 2014
San Francisco, CA

I performed statistical analyses with Kaja LeWinn, ScD, on some of her projects involving the role of social interaction in mental health outcomes in adolescents.

Graduate Student Researcher

University of California, Berkeley, School of Public Health / College of Natural Resources, Center for Weight and Health

Jun 2012 to May 2013
Berkeley, CA

  • Developed statistical analysis plans
  • Organized, "cleaned," and analyzed data in various statistical software packages
  • Communicated issues and results

Research Specialist

Emory University, Department of Economics / Department of Psychiatry, Computation and Cognitive Neuroscience Lab / Center for Neuropolicy

Aug 2005 to Aug 2011
Atlanta, GA

  • Analyzed and interpreted behavioral and MR imaging data (functional, diffusion, and anatomical)
  • Trained and supervised graduate and undergraduate students and other researchers in the lab
  • Collaborated on experiment planning and results preparation for presentation and publication
  • Programmed experiments and oversaw data collection from participants
  • Performed hardware and software setup, upkeep, and support on servers and workstations
  • Established lab "wiki" for training and information management

Trauma Patient Outcomes

Cohen, on behalf of the PROMMTT Study Group, "Statistical Machines for Trauma Hospital Outcomes Research: Application to the PRospective, Observational, Multi-Center Major Trauma Transfusion (PROMMTT) Study," PLOS ONE, vol. 10, no. 8, p. e0136438, Aug. 2015. [doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0136438]

Adolescent Mental Health Outcomes

Neurobiology of Reward in Adolescents

  1. J. B. Engelmann, S. Moore, C. M. Capra, and G. S. Berns, "Differential neurobiological effects of expert advice on risky choice in adolescents and adults," Social Cognitive and Affective Neuroscience, vol. 7, no. 5, pp. 557–567, May 2012. [doi:10.1093/scan/nss050]
  2. G. S. Berns and S. E. Moore, "A neural predictor of cultural popularity," Journal of Consumer Psychology, vol. 22, no. 1, pp. 154–160, Jan. 2012. [doi:10.1016/j.jcps.2011.05.001]
  3. G. S. Berns, C. M. Capra, S. Moore, and C. Noussair, "Neural mechanisms of the influence of popularity on adolescent ratings of music," NeuroImage, vol. 49, no. 3, pp. 2687–2696, Feb. 2010. [doi:10.1016/j.neuroimage.2009.10.070]
  4. G. S. Berns, S. Moore, and C. M. Capra, "Adolescent Engagement in Dangerous Behaviors Is Associated with Increased White Matter Maturity of Frontal Cortex," PLoS ONE, vol. 4, no. 8, p. e6773, Aug. 2009. [doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0006773]

Neurobiology of Sacred Values

Atran, "The price of your soul: neural evidence for the non-utilitarian representation of sacred values," Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society B: Biological Sciences, vol. 367, no. 1589, pp. 754–762, Jan. 2012. [doi:10.1098/rstb.2011.0262]

Neurobiology of Uncertainty over Losses

  1. G. S. Berns, C. M. Capra, J. Chappelow, S. Moore, and C. Noussair, "Nonlinear neurobiological probability weighting functions for aversive outcomes," NeuroImage, vol. 39, no. 4, pp. 2047–2057, Feb. 2008. [doi:10.1016/j.neuroimage.2007.10.028]
  2. P. V. S. Chandrasekhar, C. M. Capra, S. Moore, C. Noussair, and G. S. Berns, "Neurobiological regret and rejoice functions for aversive outcomes," NeuroImage, vol. 39, no. 3, pp. 1472–1484, Feb. 2008. [doi:10.1016/j.neuroimage.2007.10.027]
  3. G. S. Berns, C. M. Capra, S. Moore, and C. Noussair, "A shocking experiment: New evidence on probability weighting and common ratio violations," Judgment and Decision Making, vol. 2, no. 4, pp. 234–242, 2007. [journal.sjdm.org/7801/jdm7801.htm]
